definition: at first/suddenly/abruptly/to spread/(of hair) to stand on end/bristling
variant of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
variant of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
how?/how about?/how was it?/how are things?
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
how can this be?/what's to be done?/what an awful mess!
variant of 怎麼了|怎么了[zen3 me5 le5]

sentences.english: Diuretic-Refractory, Volume-Overloaded Heart Failure Patients Be Managed?
sentences.chinese: 控制利尿超荷衰患者应该接受怎治疗？

sentences.english: April bursts upon our Virginia hills in one prodigious leap.
sentences.chinese: 四月不知怎的一跃，就来到了弗吉尼亚的小坡上。

sentences.english: How say ye, We are mighty and strong men for the war?
sentences.chinese: 你们怎吗说，我们是勇士，是有勇力打仗的呢。

sentences.english: To see the Lich King destroyed?
sentences.chinese: 想看看巫妖王是怎被打败的？

sentences.english: If nobody's laughing, how come sitcoms are doing so well?
sentences.chinese: 如果没人笑的话，情景喜剧怎会这么受欢迎？

sentences.english: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?
sentences.chinese: 大卫既称他为主，他怎吗又是大卫的子孙呢。
他昨天怎堋也不肯帮我。

sentences.english: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?
sentences.chinese: 犹太人就希奇说，这个人没有学过，怎吗明白书呢。

sentences.english: Then I was switched to another teacher in the same studio. A blind male teacher.
sentences.chinese: 然后不知怎的我又再次换了另一名失明的男老师。

sentences.english: If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?
sentences.chinese: 大卫既称他为主，他怎吗又是大卫的子孙呢。

sentences.english: Shall Time's best jewel from Time's chest lie hid?
sentences.chinese: 唉，怎能够不被收进时光的宝箱？

sentences.english: Perhaps you always intend to exercise, but somehow you never get round to it.
sentences.chinese: 你也许总是在策划行动，却不知怎的从未实践。

sentences.english: How, how do you get them to flourish like this ?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎，怎么把它们种得如何茂盛的呢？

sentences.english: A mortal thing so to immortalize;
sentences.chinese: 既为一凡物，如此怎不朽？

sentences.english: I wasn't lookin' but somehow you found me.
sentences.chinese: 我无意追寻，但你却不知怎的找到了我。

definition: old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
did I ever ...? (or "did he ever ...?" etc)
can it be possible that/could it be
were it not for/if not for
